trans-unit.source: Upload a Microsoft Azure Management API Certificate into the Portal
trans-unit.target: Upload a Microsoft Azure Management API Certificate into the Portal

trans-unit.source: Learn how to upload athe Management API certficate in Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Learn how to upload athe Management API certficate in Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Upload an Azure Management API Management Certificate
trans-unit.target: Upload an Azure Management API Management Certificate

trans-unit.source: Management certificates allow you to authenticate with the Service Management API provided by Azure.
trans-unit.target: Management certificates allow you to authenticate with the Service Management API provided by Azure.

trans-unit.source: Many programs and tools (such as Visual Studio or the Azure SDK) will use these certficates to automate configuration and deployment of various Azure services.
trans-unit.target: Many programs and tools (such as Visual Studio or the Azure SDK) will use these certficates to automate configuration and deployment of various Azure services.

trans-unit.source: These are not really related to cloud services.
trans-unit.target: These are not really related to cloud services.

trans-unit.source: Be careful!
trans-unit.target: Be careful!

trans-unit.source: These types of certificates allow anyone who authenticates with them to manage the subscription they are associated with.
trans-unit.target: These types of certificates allow anyone who authenticates with them to manage the subscription they are associated with.

trans-unit.source: More information about Azure certificates (including creating a self-signed certificate) is <link><linkText>available</linkText><title></title></link> to you if you need it.
trans-unit.target: More information about Azure certificates (including creating a self-signed certificate) is <link><linkText>available</linkText><title></title></link> to you if you need it.

trans-unit.source: You can also use <link><linkText>Azure Active Directory</linkText><title></title></link> to authenticate client-code for automation purposes.
trans-unit.target: You can also use <link><linkText>Azure Active Directory</linkText><title></title></link> to authenticate client-code for automation purposes.

trans-unit.source: Upload a management certificate
trans-unit.target: Upload a management certificate

trans-unit.source: Once you have a management certficate created, (.cer file with only the public key) you can upload it into the portal.
trans-unit.target: Once you have a management certficate created, (.cer file with only the public key) you can upload it into the portal.

trans-unit.source: When the certificate is available in the portal, anyone with a matching certficiate (private key) can connect through the Management API and access the resources for the associated subscription.
trans-unit.target: When the certificate is available in the portal, anyone with a matching certficiate (private key) can connect through the Management API and access the resources for the associated subscription.

trans-unit.source: Log into the <link><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Log into the <link><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Click Settings on the left side of the portal (you may need to scroll down).
trans-unit.target: Click Settings on the left side of the portal (you may need to scroll down).

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click the Management Certificates tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the Management Certificates tab.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click the Upload button.
trans-unit.target: Click the Upload button.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Fill out the dialog information and click the done Checkmark.
trans-unit.target: Fill out the dialog information and click the done Checkmark.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Now that you have a management certficate associated with a subscription, you can (after you have installed the matching certificate locally) programatically connect to the <link><linkText>Service Management REST API</linkText><title></title></link> and automate the various Azure resources that are also associated with that subscription.
trans-unit.target: Now that you have a management certficate associated with a subscription, you can (after you have installed the matching certificate locally) programatically connect to the <link><linkText>Service Management REST API</linkText><title></title></link> and automate the various Azure resources that are also associated with that subscription.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
